byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and PATRICK HEALY

abstract: Jeb Bush, preparing to officially announce his presidential campaign, finds himself falling short of early ambitions; while Bush's fundraising has gone well, he has yet to emerge as anointed frontrunner in crowded field, and has faced skepticism concerning his competence and conservatism; criticism has been particularly strong from party activists who oppose his centrist positions; will work to refine tone alongside newly appointed campaign manager.
lead_paragraph: As he prepares to make his presidential campaign official on Monday, Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, finds himself part of a pack of candidates and the target of questions about his competence.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Works to Recover From a Shaky Start
headline.print_headline: A Shaky Start Compels Bush to Refine Tone

snippet: As he prepares to make his presidential campaign official on Monday, Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, finds himself part of a pack of candidates and the target of questions about his competence.
